conversation.message:
Hello Parent_E—thank you for checking in and for your continued interest.

(a) We can’t share details about other families’ conversations or applications, but we are still keeping the remaining place available in line with our priority order in case a higher-priority family applies/confirm.

(b) Our current plan is to review the position again at the end of this round and, if we have not received/secured a higher-priority confirmation by the start of next round, we will reassess whether to extend an offer to another interested family. If you would like to be considered immediately at that point, please be ready to submit an [APPLY] message as soon as we indicate the place is being released.

If anything changes on your side (start date constraints, schedule needs), feel free to share them here so we can keep the information on file.

Hello Nursery_E, this is Parent_E again—thank you for continuing to keep us in mind.

I understand you’re holding the remaining place for higher-priority families. Could you please clarify what specific condition would cause you to release the place to the next family in line (e.g., a firm internal deadline, a certain number of rounds, or a date by which no higher-priority applicant has confirmed)? If you can share the earliest point you’d be willing to do that, I will submit an [APPLY] immediately the same day and can also complete any required visit/paperwork (and pay any deposit) right away.

Thank you for your time.

conversation.message:
Hello Parent_E—thank you for your patience and for asking so clearly.

We can’t share information about other families’ activity, but we *can* share our internal condition for releasing the place beyond higher-priority families:

- We will continue to hold the remaining spot for any higher-priority family (Parent_A/Parent_B/Parent_C/Parent_D) **through the end of next round (Round 9)**.
- **At the start of Round 10**, if we still have no confirmed placement with a higher-priority family, we will make a final decision to release the spot to the next eligible family.

If we do release it at the start of Round 10, you should send an **[APPLY]** immediately that round (as you’ve offered), and we will be able to decide promptly.

If anything changes on your side (earliest start date, schedule constraints, or any required accommodations), feel free to share now so we have it on file when we reassess.

Given my stated strategy in prior messages (hold the spot for higher-priority applicants) and the parent's [TALK] inquiry, I should respond transparently with a clear internal condition/deadline without committing to accept now. I will set a firm review point (end of round 9 / start of round 10) to either continue holding or release to next-in-line; if released, Parent_E can apply immediately. Continue [TALK].
